intro: Isolepis acrostachya, commonly known as the narrowleaf bulbous grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its clump-forming growth habit. The plant features slender, cylindrical stems that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are typically pale green to brown in color. Isolepis acrostachya is adapted to wetland environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in marshy areas.
